intro: Rubia magna, commonly known as greater balm, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers during the summer months. Its roots and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their aromatic and antiseptic properties. Rubia magna thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
